page.title: 06NETHERHALL MANSION
page.content: Maryport was known to the romans.but there were few people here until 1066,when the Eaglesfield family took the land over.they built their house south of the River Ellen and the pele tower on the north-side.In 1528 the Senhouses took over and began to build on to the Pele tower. by 1738 Humphrey Senhouse developed the harbour and prosperity came to Maryport (named after his wife).coal and iron were shipped out;ships were built and Maryport became rich.The mansion was extended 4 times.we found many stone inscriptions bearing the initials E.P.S. (Elizabeth Pocklington Senhouse) 1883. but with the decline of coal iron shipbuilding,the fortunes of Maryport and the Senhouses declined also.by 1970 the mansion was derelict.we found only the pele tower left and hallway.
